page.title: 16Dock Farm, Meadle
page.content: DATE 10\7\85 The farm house,it was thought,was built in the 17th century.It's a 2 storied building of timber and brick with a 1 story extension. The extension was added in 1890 when part of the house was demolished. In the farmyard there are two barns an old timber/oak 17 century one and a metal Dutch barn of 1936 which is used for storing hay and straw. A modern post war concrete barn is used for housing 25 store cattle.The cattle are of Fresian crossed with Hereford,they all graze on 25 acres of high quality grassland.There are also stables made of wood with brick foundations. The farm owner,Mr.Wooster is 87 years old and has lived in the farmhouse since 1911-1926. He keeps 3 Suffolk sheep.
